body: @guozhangwang I removed the extra sensor registration APIs as you suggested, and I also agree with the rest of your comments and have addressed them. Thank you.
@guozhangwang I removed the extra sensor registration APIs as you suggested, and I also agree with the rest of your comments and have addressed them. Thank you.

@guozhangwang i've addressed your comments.
w.r.t your suggested refactoring: though i agree the hierarchy could do with some tidying up, i'm not 100% sure what you are suggesting will work and a lot of it is un-related to this PR. I think it needs some more thought and this PR has been outstanding for nearly 2 months already. Also, the changes you are suggesting are internal (i.e., not affecting public APIs), so they could be done once this PR is merged. I think we might already have a JIRA for creating Logged**Stores ? Will have to look.

The reason why I added a boolean flag in Max is consider the possibility of all negative values in the metrics, although all the **-max metrics are now non-negative. Does it make sense?

@ijuma I had run locally (Mac) the build with JDK 8 and Scala 2.11 and it passes.
Anyway I have rekicked the build by fixing a spurious extra space.

@edoardocomar, you can trigger a new build by simply telling jenkins to retest (we've had that for a few weeks now). I'll take a look at this soon. We should be able to get it into the next release given that it's really a bug fix. Without this, multiple consumers with different jaas configs won't work correctly, right? Given that, we have until the code freeze to merge it.

Btw, one thing that would be good to test: does refreshing of Kerberos tickets work correctly if different credentials are used? We call `kinit -R` in `KerberosLogin` and it would be good to verify how it behaves. Ideally, it will work correctly, but if there are issues, we should document limitations.

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/532/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

1) The point is, that currently only a regex prefix is checked. Thus, a file might contain not the full license header and the build would succeed. After the regex which checks only the first few words matches you can put anything into the header... (it's not about formatting).

For example, this header passed the build:
```
/**
 * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
 * foo bar
 */
```

2) I did not pay attention to import reordering... I can revert those if required.

3) This seems like a good idea -- as the header file is provided by the PR, people can easily c&p into their IDE setting.

> I think it needs some more thought and this PR has been outstanding for nearly 2 months already.

I understand... Just afraid such tech debt will keep growing and eventually come back and bite us as unstable and hard-to-debug code. Well how about merging this PR as is and see if we can still push it as a separate PR before the release deadline?

The fix LGTM. Would be nice to have some test cases for `readFully`. Maybe that wouldn't be too bad using a mock for `FileChannel`?
Good point about the test, I had asked for it and then forgot to reply to @amethystic's question. I agree with @hachikuji that it would be useful to have a simple test with a mocked `FileChannel`.
@IJuma Do you suggest any further improvements?

I am trying to use this method and find it a bit ugly because it expects a vararg of a generic type.
This means if you have a collection of KStreams you want to feed to it, your only option is to cast the return of a call to collection.toArray() and add an @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation:

`KStream<MyKey, MessageValue<? extends MyValue> merged = builder.merge( ( KStream<MyKey, MessageValue<? extends MyValue> [] ) collection.toArray() );`

It would be a lot simpler if there was a version of merge that just accepted Collection<KStream>.
@dguy When I was adding `LockException` in another PR, I was explicitly requested to add more ctors even if I did not use them (see https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2233/files#r92231489)
@ewencp that makes sense, I made this update and verified the test passes locally.
@guozhangwang Updated
Thanks, merged to trunk.

> was explicitly requested to add more ctors even if I did not use them

I am actually preferring to have the ctors in place even if they are not used yet. But again this is pure-subjective.

Yeah that is right. There were no hard-stone rules about how we should discuss about deprecations. Lately we are doing it more often in mailing list since it is most visible in the community. As for this specific deprecation, I think people would likely come to consensus quickly so shouldn't be much overhead.

What is the use case for using the console consumer with the ZK-based consumer? Generally, we've restricted ourselves to fixing critical bugs in the old clients and we are in the process of deprecating the old consumers via KIP-109 (the old producers are already deprecated).

@shikhar This looks good. The only issue is that we also use `VerifiableSource.messages()` in `test_bounce` as well to do validation of sequence numbers. Since we record each twice now, I think we might need to tweak that test or change it to use the new `committed_messages()` method.
@ewencp good catch, I will update that.

Hi @guozhangwang  and @ijuma 

Did more updates, so it's your turn again :)
@ewencp updated
